meanings.definition: A play for theater, radio, or television.
meanings.sent1: We watched a school drama about friendship.
meanings.sent2: The theater group performed a historical drama last night.
meanings.sent3: The comedy club accidentally put on a drama instead of a comedy, and it was hilarious.
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a drama, with unexpected twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The drama unfolded on stage, captivating the audience with its intensity.

meanings.definition: A situation or series of events marked by conflict or emotion.
meanings.sent1: Family dramas can sometimes be challenging to navigate.
meanings.sent2: The workplace drama was causing stress among the employees.
meanings.sent3: The drama of finding a lost puppy ended happily when it was reunited with its owner.
meanings.sent4: The political drama played out on the news every night, keeping viewers engaged.
meanings.sent5: The drama of the storm approaching made everyone rush to prepare for the worst.
